Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel if you have better choice”
Reviews.Author: Kubaye
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friend for 4 days. I can hardly point out anything really good. Free internet is true but you can barely get connected. We actually used the free wifi from nearby residence Inn. This is really funny. Breakfast is very simple and no cafeteria. Anyway, I wont visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MiGuel M
Reviews.Content: I stay with my family for a week and the rooms were always clean, everyone was helpful specially john in the lobby telling us great place to visit and shop, also a good breakfast, the rooms are old but the location of the hotel is great near little italy and the harbor, also great rates.

Reviews.Title: “An average motel room in an OK part of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: theimmc
Reviews.Content: The rooms are old but clean. The biggest drawback of the location is the proximity to the train tracks and airport. You definitely want to keep your windows closed. Parking is free, and the Maritime Museum is a short walk away. You definitely need a car to get around San Diego, though, so it's good that there's free parking. Some of the hotel sites mentioned that waffles are served for breakfast. To our disappointment we were told this was discontinued some time ago. With free wifi, I'd definitely consider staying here next time I'm in San Diego, but I'd also consider a few places nearby that's slightly less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Tyler L
Reviews.Content: Me and a group of friends stayed almost a week for a convention in San Diego. there were always clean towels, everyone was always helpful, and they always had a good breakfast. The part I appreciate most was the last day we had to check out but we still had business at the ACS Convention Center so they held our bags until we had to come back and be picked up by the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: D_Tebas
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night in San Diego with my wife but it was a very good stay and they gave us a large and comfortable room. The only downside was the noise from the nearby rail. But it was not a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: wayne146
Reviews.Content: This place was a very good value. Great location, and John, the front desk person was very personable and helpful. I would reccomend this place.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Deal for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: indietravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I am usually on the go when I vacation. So I was just looking for a decent, affordable place to crash in a good location. This place surpassed the expectations I had based on reviews I read before booking. John was working the desk for most of my stay, and was extremely friendly and helpful. There is some noise from trains, but it never kept me awake or woke me up. The hotel is just a couple blocks away from Little Italy, a charming neighborhood. It is also in close proximity to trolley lines, bus to the airport, and the ferry to Coronado. The rooms were clean and well-kept. I couldn't have been more happy with my experience. If I make it back to San Diego, I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: abiv56
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night, preparing for the blues cruise on Sunday, but our impression is very positive for this small hotel/inn. The location is superb, within walking distance to the port and seaside, and John at the front desk was very helpful in advicing us for a meal in Little Italy as well as where to find some groceries on a Saturday evening. Quite simple breakfast, but you can get everything you need nearby for a small amount, so that´s no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Inn and Suites- San Diego, CA”
Reviews.Author: oldbajalady
Reviews.Content: This property is an excellent location for any San Diego based activities. It is one block from the San Diego Bay and one block to get onto Hwy 5- we had to be in San Diego for oncology appointments at Balboa Naval Hospital and found this location and price to be very convenient and affordable. The property is well maintained, carpeting all looked very new and very clean. the staff, especially the front desk, Shari and John are knowledgeable about the area and very helpful. We will book there again whether attending doctor appointments or picking up friends flying into San Diego. The airport is less than a mile, BUT we never heard the planes. They offer a continental breakfast and there are so many nearby restaurant that you can walk to in Little Italy or the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us, and I'm picky.”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelgal
Reviews.Content: This is not the kind of hotel I would normally consider, but there was a convention in town in December and we needed a hotel close to the cruise port. However, this place worked FINE for us. Yes, there was some noise from the trains going by, but I just closed the window, turned on the air conditioner, and didn't have any problem at all. And the trains had stopped running by the time we went to bed. This is a small, 60's style hotel with a very small front office and rooms accessed from the outside. The only thing I didn't like was having to lug my very heavy suitcase (for a two week cruise to Hawaii) up the outside stairs. Our room was very tastefully decorated. It had been recently renovated. The bathroom was small but had decorator tile and a granite countertop. The king sized bed was quite comfortable. The room also had comfortable furniture and decorator colored walls, and nice bedspreads and bedding. The front desk lady when we checked in was fantastic and so helpful. She called a taxi to take us to the cruise port the next morning. It arrived in less than 5 minutes. The hotel even had maps on the counter showing all the eating establishments in the area. (However, the guy behind the front desk the next morning seem disinterested and not particularly friendly.) The continental breakfast consisted of your typical bagels, pastries, fruits, cereals, etc. as well as coffee and juices. The only place to sit was at several tables on the covered front porch, but we just brought our food up to our room and ate at the nice table in there which was just fine. It may not have been the fanciest hotel in the area, but it was close (walking distance) to everything, and the room itself was not that much different than at the nicer hotels I usually stay at. If you are looking for a place near the Gas Lamp area and cruise port, this will work fine for you.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great breakfast spread”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Hong
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night. Great location, walking distance from Gaslamp Quarter, Little Italy, USS Midway museum and Maritime Museum, amongst others. Breakfast spread is surprising large, and good. Room was a bit noisy during the day and in the evening, because of the railroad tracks right beside the hotel, but the trains stopped running by bedtime. All in all, a pretty good stay and one I will recommend to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Wedding Stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryK K
Reviews.Content: I cant say enough good about the people who own, manage, and operate this vintage California motel! I want to say thank you to Sherri, John, Chintan,Pete for your warm hospitality and very competent and helpful service! I enjoyed meeting and getting to know you a little and I wish you well! The cleaning crew is just excellent, so good at their work, the rooms are wonderfully clean and well appointed. And the ladies and gentlemen who do this very important job are so nice as are the desk staff! I was more than comfortable, I was at home. I enjoyed every minute of my stay and will return when the occasion arises. Thank you so very much, you know just how to run the best motel on the Harbor! May the Lord Bless and keep all of you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisa T
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable, and the continetal breakfast was better than expected, but the hotel staff was why we will stay here again. They went out of their way to make our trip exceptional. Jennifer was very nice and accomodating for our early morning departure.

Reviews.Title: “Comments from Cleveland, Ohio”
Reviews.Author: CKZSBB
Reviews.Content: The rooms are cleaned every day and the cleaning people work hard and do a good job. If you do encounter a problem with anything in the room the staff has it attended to right away. In the future, maybe there could be a computer kiosk in the main loby so that people that do not bring their laptops with them can view things on line and print things out. I cannot say enough about how good the staff is. The staff was very helpful and attentive to my needs. They are very experienced. If we needed a cab right away, it was there in a matter of seconds thanks to the staff. Thank you Jennifer for making sure that I got off on my way back home to Cleveland in the wee hours of a Sunday morning. It was greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: alisdair t
Reviews.Content: Stopped for 2 nights as part of my 16 night road trip, location was very good regarding access for San Diego attractions, 5 mins walk to tram station, we were worried a little about the train noise but did not affect us too much as we were right next to reception, but did hear some door noise from there on the second night. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on, and the whole room was well furnished. The continental breakfast was ok, and free. Free wi fi was also a bonus, great value overall

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a noisy city”
Reviews.Author: davidjones533
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of a road-trip. The hotel is excellently located, just a block from the bay and close to the main attractions, and within a 10-minute walk to the lively Gaslamp district or Little Italy - where there are plenty of restaurants and bars. It's also only a 10-minute drive to the zoo or Balboa Park. The room was clean and comfortable with good Wi-Fi, while the small pool area was sunny, and the parking was free with plenty of spaces. Breakfast was great, but perhaps lacked enough seating. Just one word of caution: the very central location of San Diego airport and the honking trains that run through the city meant there was some significant noise from sunrise until close to midnight. The hotel are upfront about this on their website and we knew what to expect, so we have no complaints, but if you are a light sleeper I would perhaps pay the extra for a more expensive hotel that may perhaps have better sound insulation. I think every hotel in this price range in central San Diego will have a similar problem.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: SuperXIX
Reviews.Content: For our 2 nights (Aug 23 – 24, 2011) stay in San Diego during our whirlwind West Coast trip, this hotel was as a comfortable, affordable ($88 + tax/night) and well positioned as we could have wished for. GOOD: The location is somewhat convenient as you could walk into the downtown core of San Diego for any night life (15min walk). For anything else, such Old Town, San Diego Zoo, Sea World, you will need to drive, but they are all pretty close. The continental breakfast is actually good and has quite a bit of selection. Since the hotel is designed like a motel with exterior access, access to your parked car is quick. The rooms are spacious and very clean. Despite other negative reviews about the loud noise of trains, our room was located very close to reception and we didn’t hear anything that would wake us up. Our bathroom was also very nicely stocked with even some Axe gel samples which I found pretty unique. The staff at the front desk is very friendly and accommodating. BAD: Nothing really negative comes to mind. I guess the nearby train tracks could cause grief for some travelers, but we only found it mildly inconvenient more about the fact that we had to wait for passing trains during our walks into downtown (to go across) rather than the noise. We really enjoyed San Diego, with its Old Town and fabulous Mexican restaurants, the gorgeous Balboa Park which reminded us of Seville, Spain, the nightlife downtown and the splendid sunset seen from the Sunset Cliffs where the sun came down from clouds and then vanished gloriously into the horizon. The convenience and value of this hotel fitted our plans perfectly and we wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again during any future trips to this relaxing city.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the rates they charged”
Reviews.Author: jazzprom
Reviews.Content: All in all, it was okay but not worth the rates we were charged. Pros: - Good location, a very short walk from the County Centre/Little Italy Trolley station which then easily gets you via Trolley to the Old Town in one direction, or the Santa Fe Amtrak station, downtown and the Gaslamp Quarter in the other direction. Also, very short walk to Little Italy with lots of choice for cafes and bistros. Rite Aid pharmacy around the corner. - Reasonably clean room, clean sheets and clean bathroom. - Good internet wi-fi connection. - Complimentary breakfast served, although we did not eat there. - Very obliging frontdesk staff Cons: - The Amtrak tracks run right behind the hotel, right outside our room window with the loud rumble every time a train passed through late at night and from early in the mornings - kind of like in those scenes from the movie 'My Cousin Vinny." Not too much of a bother for us but on the contrary quite amusing. However, I list it as a con as a quiet restful sleep is important to most travellers. - The air conditioner was very old and as loud as a Ford diesel truck engine. - The housekeeping staff never smiled, always had a tired disinterested, look on the faces, making us wonder if they were treated well. When we gently reminded one of them to place bottled water in our room, which they had forgotten to do, there was no acknowledgement or response to our communication although we did see 2 bottles in or room when we returned.

Reviews.Title: “We absalutely loved it, this was a great trip.”
Reviews.Author: shana442
Reviews.Content: Jennifer, at the front desk was amazing, I left my cell phone charger at another hotel she stayed with me trying to find me a store, and finally gave me her own charger!! She is awesome thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Hope To Be Back Soon”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer B
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed our stay with you. Your crew keeps the pool area so clean & nice. Our room has been well taken care of. Everyone has been so friendly & helpful. Shari at the front desk is the frosting on your cake. She was SO helpful to us and took care of our needs. She had all the answers for us and was so friendly. She has a sparkling personality and dresses with style. We hope we will be back again. Sincerely, Mrs. Floyd Dietlein

Reviews.Title: “A good deal and a nice place.”
Reviews.Author: doncab3563
Reviews.Content: Free continental breakfast, free wi-fi, clean and simple rooms, cable TV, and a small swimming pool. The location is reasonably convenient to many parts of the city. The staff was helpful and friendly. One guy at the desk one night was less pleasant but Shari deserves special mention; she is a true delight, very nice and helpful. The nearest trolley stop is right around the corner or the transfer station is just a few blocks away. Even if you skip the trolley and walk all the way to the convention center or Gaslamp Quarter, it's a pleasant 10-15 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: miraDonegal
Reviews.Content: we stayed here memorial day weekend, coming from ireland we were unaware of the holiday weekend and were quoted a higher rate than normal but when we arrived jayson recognised us as having stayed before and gave us a good deal. this hotel is so convenient to most everything, amtrak at the back is the cause of some noise but how good is that to have a train stop a block and a half away. rooms are always fresh and clean, continental breakfast is substantial and included in the price of the room. the italian quarter is 2 blocks back with some great restauants and the airport is a $10.00 ride away. great place, great location and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: awesomekate101
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay. Everything was simple and clean. Its a great hotel if you need a clean place to stay with a budget. We will definetly be back it was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “One to Remember!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: tscavo31
Reviews.Content: The pacific inn was a nice little boutique motel. We booked through the phone with a woman named Vicky. We simply wanted a room with 2 beds because it was me my wife and 2 little children. She actually recommend the kid suite instead which was a room with one bed and a bunk bed for the kids. When we got to the hotel our room wasn’t ready so the front desk told us we could keep our luggage in the back and we could hang out in the pool area while we waited for the maid to clean it. It was no problem though because the room was ready in 45 minutes. When we got into the room the kids were so excited because back home in Louisiana they share one big bed. The next day we ate breakfast at the hotel and went to Sea world. If you have never been to Sea world then you have to go. It was amazing to see all the different animals they had there. The next 2 nights consisted of going to the zoo and old town. There is plenty to do in San Diego. You will never get bored.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: ESRItrip
Reviews.Content: The overall was nice. very helpful and nice staff. Special thanks to Shari!

Reviews.Title: “Work and Relax at the same time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelmania911
Reviews.Content: I come to san diego all the time for work. I stay at different hotels each time I come down but none compares to this one. The people were so nice and ready to help me whether it was with my bags or calling a taxi. They offered free wi-fi which most hotels now a days offer but charge. Honestly just trust me your definitely going to want to stay here. The Rooms are worth the price and the breakfast was delicious and FREE! I will definitely be back next month. I already booked my room!!! Thanks a lot to the wonderful front desk clerks especially Darshan and his sister Aarti!!!

Reviews.Title: “a hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: kingyEngland
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the pacific inn for three nights and found the rooms large with a good sized bathrom a small fridge and a flat screen tv. the room we stayed in was also in good condition and clean what more could you want. the inn provides a small free breakfast with a small patio or a swimming pool area to sit round. the inn is in an excellant position for visiting the gas lamp area little italy the harbour area its also close to the airport. the trolley that goes all round the sights of san diego is just round the corner. i read the reviews before i went, so new the amtrack line was just behind the inn. and if you are a light sleeper this is not the place for you,(they are noisey buggers) but a lot of the well known hotels are also on the line, may be they have quadruple glazing. i would like to say the staff were friendly and gave excellant info on the area which is handy when only in town for a a couple of days. i would say this inn provides excellant value for money

Reviews.Title: “Best place we have lived/found since the beginning of our road trip”
Reviews.Author: buggly25
Reviews.Content: Our host, Jayson, did a great job. We have appreciated his advises (restaurants to go, must-seen in Diego, etc.) and his kindness. He was answering all our questions with a smile. Thx to you, bro.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: VeteranTraveller73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to see my son graduated from Marine Corps Basic Training (India Co/Plt. 3020). It was a proud moment for myself and my wife. Being from Las Vegas and experienced travelers, we have rather high standards for hotel rooms. But for this trip we were also very budget minded so we weren't expecting much. The location is perfect. Close enough to the activity Downtown and walking distance to the waterfront and Little Italy. Only a two mile drive drive up Pacific Hwy to MCRD. The Marriott, it's not. But at a reserved price of $75, it's a really good deal. I'd definitely say that the Pacific Inn & Suites are a good go between upper end (Marriott) and budget (Motel 6). The rooms were remodeled with brand-new pillow top beds and the carpet was fresh and new. I needed to use the Wi-Fi for some business and it was free of charge. Continental breakfast that included waffles and hard-boiled eggs (more than just muffins and donuts) was provided. Sadly, we couldn't sit at the patio because it was full. One of the two women behind the counter (I believe it was Vicky, the manager) suggested we go to the pool area. Which we did. It was great! We met some other parents with their son graduating up the road. The down side is that parking is a bear and can get full quick (especially on busy nights). I suggest getting there early in the evening and parking. Downtown/Gaslamp is a short trolley ride. And the complaints are true about the train that passes through twice a night. Light sleepers should get a room towards the front. It's not anything that the hotel can do anything about and is something you will have to deal with if you stay along that line. Also, there's no convenience stores close by so if you plan on having snacks/beverages in your room, pick them up before you settle in for the night. Overall, it was a great stay and Pacific Inn met and exceeded our expectations. I suggest booking and confirming early to get the best rate and checking in as early as possible to maximize your value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: profH10
Reviews.Content: For its years, this hotel was clean and well-maintained (thank you to the cleaning staff). I stayed in a non-smoking room, and for the first time I noticed the room did not have a stale kind of smell like others do. I have no problems with noise, but if you are a light sleeper, the only sounds I heard were from doors and the nearby train. Parking faces all the rooms, therefore, you can see your car if you need to. My stay was for one night only, but I would stay longer if needed. The desk clerks were very helpful in giving me directions. I went for a concert at the 4th and B, and I walked to/from the venue. People who complain in other reviews about the homeless, they were harmless.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably loud train horns”
Reviews.Author: need_to_sleep
Reviews.Content: Anything nice that could be said about this otherwise standard motel is negated by trains that blow their horns as they pass. Even without the horns, it's exceptionally noisy. Not only is there the sound of the trains on the tracks, there is a constant rumbling of some large machine occasionally interrupted by a tocsin that sounds like a truck is backing up, banging sounds, and something that sounds like a jackhammer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Awesome Service!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaMam
Reviews.Content: I am a hotel manager for a resort in Hawaii. So I know how important it is to treat your customers with kindness, friendliness, and respect. I was happy to find some of this "Aloha" spirit at Pacific Inn. Sherry at the front desk was of great service to us, and she made our trip to San Diego great by recommending some wonderful place to eat and shop. The cleaning staff were very thorough, and the pool, while small, was clean. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The place reeks of cigarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: capolstons
Reviews.Content: My kids couldn't wait to get out of here. And we would have checked out right away, except you have to prepay for your stay -- that should have been a warning. There were stains on the sheets and cigarette burns in the blankets. We checked in because we were having work done on our house and needed to be out for a few days. I didn't expect luxury accommodations I just needed a place to sleep. I'm not generally critical and didn't even really mind the old, tiny towels or the paper thin walls, but I had to launder even our unworn our clothing and still can't bring our suitcases back into the house, they smell so. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jacobgram
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples with reservations for 8 days. We were assigned rooms 103 & 105 when we made the reservation. We were told that all rooms had refrigerators. When we arrived at 5 PM, room 105 had been given away - and our friends were put in room 104 - no refrigerator and no closet - just a rack. Our room had a very small bed - with a dip in the middle - I am sure it was meant to be a single room. Our friends could not be moved until the next day which meant we had to hang around until noon. Since there is no bread for breakfast we had to buy a loaf in 7-11. The breakfast room has no seating so breakfast has to be carried to the room - there were no trays. The room is locked until 7 AM - so eary coffee is unavailable. My friends asked for a coffee pot after 2 days and we did get one. The trains - which we were told ended at 11 pm kept us up at night. The rooms were very clean but the shabby furniture gave it a dingy look. Location WAS great so if you do not mind noise, a small bed and breakfast after 7 you might be OK with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: drmunawar41
Reviews.Content: I went for the business trip in San Diego and l stay in Pacific Inn near harbour. It was very pleasant stay in the hotel and the front desk people were very helpful. The rooms are clean and maids did very good job. Breakfast was good I only stay there for 2 nights. Hopefully will going to stay more nights next time. I would recommend 5 stars for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFULL, HOMLY ,LOVELY, ENJOYABLE, REMEMBERABLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: sablok
Reviews.Content: you get more for what you pay less for. keep it up the way you are doing and wish you all the best.

Reviews.Title: “OK place for good location and modest price”
Reviews.Author: moalta
Reviews.Content: A basic motel room with a basic breakfast included but available only before 9:30 am. Towels very thin. Room very basic; did not have mirror; comfortable king size bed; fridge; very clean. Was $10 cheaper ($60 US plus taxes) booking direct than via Expedia. Exterior sign advertised hot waffles which is true, together with bagels, apples, oranges, a few cereal choices, and pretty bad coffee. No muffins or bread/toast the day I was there. Not much space on the patio to eat... you may have to take your breakfast to the room. The motel is very close to the waterfront, convenient parking, not far from downtown. I was closer to the Pacific Highway side than the rail line and had no trouble sleeping. Recommendation would only be on the basis of central and relatively cheap - though you can still find $40 rooms further out from central San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Everything”
Reviews.Author: taurus430
Reviews.Content: When we first checked and went to the room, it was located way in the back near the train tracks. We asked to be re-located and the next day we were moved to the front of the hotel. I read reviews about the train problem at these hotels all along Pacific Ave. This hotel was very good value for money. Excellent location for restaurants and shopping. Front Desk Staff was very helpful and the Maintenance staff were very polite also. Maids were very polite and did a great service. Free bottles of water put in the room daily, rooms even had a fridge and microwave. Breakfast was complimentary and very nice. We enjoyed making our waffles, plus there was coffee, hot/cold cereal, juice and fruit. This is not only a big conveniece but helps with cost of eating out. I agree with another review that the towels were very thin and some of the rooms had furniture that was mended. I believe the rooms had been recently renovated but the AC didn't work that well for us. The lo cool was like a huricane and the compressor kept kicking on and off with no fan staying on. If you're a light sleeper, between the AC and the train can be a problem. We got through it. I don't understand why San Diego is layed out the way it was with hotels lined up near train/trolley tracks and not near the Harbor View Hwy and Administration/commercial buildings are across the street where the hotels should be. All in all, I look forward to another stay at this hotel and did very much enjoy San Diego!!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! dont order food delivery off fliers slipped into the door”
Reviews.Author: 2travelexperts
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I ordered of a cheap flier some pizza and received the worst food ever SERIOUSLY im not one too waste food but this time i literally dumped 32.00 in the garbage. they refused to give me a refund and "abelina pizza" didnt have a listed address. the room was a good deal and it was really nice and clean. some advise though get a second floor room because at times we could hear the couple above us have sex! the train can get a little noisy but it only last about 45seconds

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: NanBou
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a trip to San Diego. I stayed at the 500 West from September 6th to 8th. 1) Very Good Location Right on Pacific Highway, close to the airport and public transportation. Just a fiew blocks away from Little Italy. However, since I am a light sleeper, I had problems sleeping between the traffic, the trains and the planes. 2) Very good rooms The rooms are very clean, spacious and air conditioned. Bonus: rates include breakfast. 3) Great staff Very helpful, patient and professional staff. I would recommend this hotel for someone: - who is not a light sleeper - wanting a fairly-priced, well located hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: usa_is_better
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good value for money. Excellent location for restaurants and shopping. Staff very helpful, and willing to go the extra mile. Maintenance staff were very polite and even fixed things we didn't realize needed fixing. Maids were very polite and did a great service. Free bottles of water put in the room daily, rooms even had a large fridge we cir,d use. Breakfast was complimentary and very nice. Reception staff were great, the guy in particular. Sorry i forgot his name. Free wifi throughout the hotel which was fast and trouble free.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint motel, good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: lovepea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "kids suite" with five adults. The room was large enough for us, had a nice-sized fridge and microwave. The beds were pretty comfortable. The bathroom was average size and motel quality. When we first checked in, there was a plumbing issue with the toilet, but in 2 minutes the serviceman was there and had everything fixed just fine. We heard the trains in the daytime with the windows open, but when we shut the windows at night, there was no noise problems at all. The woman checking us in was very friendly and extremely helpful. The make your own waffles for breakfast were good, plus there was box cereals, muffins and some fruit. The area was good and was walkable for us to get to the gaslamp & convention center. Also, if you choose to take a taxi, it is about $6 for a van. It was also not a far drive to get to Old Town. The downsides to the room was that the furniture was pretty beat up. It looked like something clawed the dressers. Plus the carpetting was a little worn. Also the towels they provide were tiny, thin and a bit rough. They were clean though. Overall, the stay wasn't bad. The price was pretty high for the experience we had, but given that all the downtown hotels were sold out the weekend we went, it was expected.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: bhavik97
Reviews.Content: Well first of all the front desk was awesome they helped us with all of our needs, from directions to irons. It was great because it was our first time in San Diego and the hotel was close to everything! I recommend this hotel to everyone when coming to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: LaveenWhencanwego
Reviews.Content: This was a clean hotel with great location. You could hear the train but it didn't keep us awake at all. The rooms although a bit small were well maintained. The desk staff was awesome. Shari, the morning clerk, helped us plan our day over breakfast on the great patio and the night clerk helped us find the best Mexican restaurant. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shunter27
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay - was travelling with 3 friends and we all fitted in one room, great value. Unlimited waffles in the morning were fantastic. Definately using PI again when I'm back in San Diego. Staff were fantastic - we had to move rooms one night (our fault because we booked it so late) but the staff were amazing and moved our stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: AnettF
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights from April 13th, and have already desided to look it up next time we are in San Diego. Yes - the hotel is very sentrally localted, right between the airport, the train and the pacific Highway. (-: The trains do make noice, but you get used to it. You can walk to little italy in a 5 minutes max, to hard rock cafe and most of downtown in 20. Breakfast and service is nice as already mentioned in the reviews. A little cold to eat outside on the porch. Minus for no coffemaker in the room, but they had some in the reception at most times of day/night. WiFi not always good, need to be fixed to be good in all rooms. Ours was just under the antenna with too much wall/floor in between. It is not that fun to work by the pool - at night. (-:

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: freddo56
Reviews.Content: Supposed to get an upgraded room....very basic. Carpets were being cleaned on arrival. Found used baby's nappy (diaper) under bed in morning. Breakfast was included but was basic and you ate it at the entrance to office.....chairs and tables outside but it was freezing. Train track behind hotel, but didnt really bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Value for money”
Reviews.Author: lucky5Sf
Reviews.Content: I had been to Pacific Inn with friends last month... The rooms are clean, spacious and have great views..... The staff is courteous and friendly. Dhiman,one of the staff gave us great tips on the neighborhoods to visit and made our stay very comfortable.. I loved the place....

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleased with the Pacific Inn.”
Reviews.Author: Manchacafats
Reviews.Content: I am a retired proffessor of English whose all-consuming hobby is playing in duplicate bridge tournaments, Since the American Contract Bridge Leaague was holding one of its National Bridge Championships in San Diego from Nov 26 through December 6th, I naturally wanted to attend, However, since I'm not wealthy I was not anxious to stay at the host hotel (Hyatt) whose "discounted " room rates were in the $175/room-night range. Thus I was delighted to learn that the Pacific Inn was available at a reasonable price. I was delighted with the accomodations at the Pacific. The rooms were spacious ( 2 huge double beds) and the housekeeping was immaculate. The clerks at the front desk were extremely friendly and efficient, and knowlegeable about the city's tourist attractions, although I did not do much sightseeing. The complimentary Continental breakfaxt of coffee, juice, cereal and fruit was augmented by a do-it-yourself waffle machine , and was a just fine way to start the day. In short, I would recommend the Pacific Inn to any travelers seeking affordable rooms conveniently located in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: doctorhand
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised. Often people who travel with pets, and are on a budget, have very few choices on accomodations and are frequently stuck staying at "flea bag" motels. This is absolutely not the case here. Our room was very clean, newly painted, with upgraded facilites. The staff was very nice. One of the reviews I read complained about the noise from the passing trains; however, we were not disturbed by the passing of trains at all. We heard the horn once or twice, but that was it. The location is nice also, very close to downtown. I will definately be visiting The Pacific Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service makes it”
Reviews.Author: aeboliviano
Reviews.Content: Not only was my service great during the stay, when I left my phone charger in the room, Shari found it and helped mail it back to me the next week. The service (&location) makes this the best hotel value I've had in a long time. Really.

Reviews.Title: “Too much noise”
Reviews.Author: DebraArizona
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and heard the trains blaring their horns all day and all night. The 1-3 AM blarings were the worst. The room was clean, but in need of update. Stains on the celing and carpet, parking very tight and not enough spaces. It is conventiently located to downtown, piers, and not far from the beaches. I will not stay here again, and unless you sleep like a log...I would recommend you find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: briturner07
Reviews.Content: "My boyfriend and I go to San Diego all the time now, this hotel was the first we stayed at on our first trip, and everything was great. I had requested a bottle of cider and roses for us and upon arrival they gave us an arrangement of roses, cider, and free chocolates, and just when I thought that was it when we arrived to our room they roses in the shape of a heart on the bed, and scattered petals in the bathroom, and two glasses. They were very helpful, the room was clean, just enough towels, and free breakfeast! Great customer service, and very attentive to our needs"

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy - but be aware the Amtrak rail is VERY noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Nice little place with friendly staff and decent rooms. Beds are comfy and rooms are clean with free WiFi. The only issue is that the Amtrak railway line runs right behind this place and the Amtrak trains like to blow their horns as they go past and it is seriously loud!!! I got used to it pretty quick, but it might stop some people sleeping at all! Other than that, this place is ideally located near to the airport, harbour and districts such as the Gaslamp and Little Italy. Would recommend if you are on a budget and are no a light sleeper!! Oh - and the waffles at breakfast are very tasty! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Room was great and very clean”
Reviews.Author: hatraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked the room at the last minute and was not sure what it was going to be like. We were very pleased with the room. Especially with the cleaniness of the room and the hotel. The breakfast was great. Shari at the front desk was very professional and willing to help in any way she could. The entire staff at the hotel was very friendly. We will surely return to this hotel on our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, helpful staff, clean room, good rate, great value”
Reviews.Author: LJTravel42
Reviews.Content: We booked a night here at the last minute but had very helpful and friendly help with the reservation. On arrival we were greeted by Lindsey at the front desk, who was helpful, friendly and efficient. We had arrived after flying in from a long meeting and her attitude lightened our spirits for the whole evening. The room was neat, clean and an excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: sals810
Reviews.Content: We walked in off the street and to our suprise we got an excellent rate. The Inn is located within walking distance to everything the bay. The service was excellent. If we ever go back to San Diego, we will stay there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Airport Inn in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Senor_Miguel
Reviews.Content: Great Place, Great People, close to Little Italy. Sherri and Pete at the front desk really did a great job taking care of me. I reserved the room about three weeks in advance by calling the Inn directly and talking with Sherri. Everything was perfect when I arrived on Good Friday in the afternoon, even though the Inn was full due to the holiday weekend and a convention in town. My favorite room was waiting, and they arranged to take care of my car while I left on a weeklong business trip the next morning. Also arranged executive car service for the airport at 7 am. Great place for a weary traveler between business trips. Can't beat it!!! -- mike

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: downbythebay
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with friends, and found the experience enjoyable. The Pacific Inn & Suites is close to everything, so there is no need to take your car out of the parking lot. We walked everywhere, and if walking was not a possible, the trolley is just a couple of blocks away. The staff is great, very friendly and helpful. Shari was always extremely pleasant and willing to do what she could to make our stay more enjoyable. The rooms definitely aren't 5 star, but they are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is continental, with fresh made hot waffles, so a great start to the day. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in Harbour Town area”
Reviews.Author: yonamt1946
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed out stay, workers were helpfull and friendly. Close to Little Italy, you could walk to this area! Room was large , very clean and comforterable beds. I would recommend this property for a famioly or couoples vacation. Good breakfast, nice selections.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: felipeld
Reviews.Content: It was such a good deal because it is a simple and clean hotel very well located. I stayed in San Diego with my family from Thursday to Sunday. Walk Distance to Little Italy, Harbor, Pier, Downtown. Close to the Airport, PB, OB. Girls from front desk were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast has nothing special, just continental breakfast to make you feel full in the morning. Reasonable parking lot. I do recommend this place if you dont wanna spend that much of money and want to stay in a standard, nice and affordable place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: hotdesert12
Reviews.Content: We came to town for a conference. We found the room to be very clean and the staff very helpful. Very close to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: rtcd06
Reviews.Content: clean hotel, friendly staff, great location. right off the historic little italy and gaslamp quarters! good price for the location. walking distance from the ocean. would stay there again!:)

Reviews.Title: “Great place at reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Travelforfun20
Reviews.Content: Nice place very close to the water, airport, walking distance from Little Italy. Lots of great restaurants nearby. The room was clean, and quiet, despite the proximity to the train tracks. Great place for the person on the go who wants to come back to the hotel to refresh before dinner and take a nice rest for the night. The breakfast offered cereal, danishes, assorted fruit, and I was surprised by the fact that you could bake your own waffle, which were surprisingly tasty. They would have been wonderful if they offered a variety of syrups and fresh fruits such as strawberries and blueberries, but again this is not IHOP. The staff was helpful with general information and for booking tours at discounted rates Overall a great place for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: jesskhs
Reviews.Content: This was such a wonderful experience. Meredith was so helpful to us during our stay. We were a little lost, but she helped us find our way by drawing out maps for us and helping us with anything we needed. The pool area was great with beautiful loung chairs and it was kept very tidy. The room was very pleasant. It was very spacious and extremely clean. Overall this experience couldn't have been any better. I will definately reccomend this hotel and will be returning in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly, and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: crazyat32806
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to San Diego and the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. They helped us make shuttle arrangements for the zoo, rental car to travel to La Jolla and just did everything they could to see that our stay was enjoyable. The rooms were very clean and the pool was small, but nice. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: sfdogsbody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Inn & Suites for two nights over Memorial Day weekend. It's conveniently located downtown near the water, shops, and restaurants, and we had no trouble parking in the lot. While is it located near train tracks and the airport, we were never bothered by the transit noises that we could hear every now and again. The customer service we received was great; housekeeping and the front desk were helpful and conscientious. The room was not fancy, but it was clean and had a fridge, microwave, and little safe. Our favorite part of the stay was the continental breakfast that they serve- the fresh do-it-yourself Belgian waffles were awesome, and the stay was extremely pleasurable overall.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimdwatson2003
Reviews.Content: this is a small but comfortable hotel right off the ocean.. the accomadations were very comfortable and the price was very reasonable. i would highly recommend it to anyone staying for a night or a week

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent price”
Reviews.Author: azmegan1979
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place close to the water. It was our first trip in over a year with out the kids. Parking did stink, although we were always able to get a spot even when we got back to our room at 2am! Close to alot of great food and our airport which made sleeping in alot easier! The breakfast was awesome! I loved making my own hot waffle with their wonderful waffle iron, makes me want to go back just for that reason alone. The beds were a little stiff and the room kinda small, but we were on vacation to go and explore San Diego, not stay in our room all day and night. We slept through the train, never heard it in the middle of the night. And the staff was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Treatment for a Hotel before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: emac02
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay and the staff gave us good information as to events and places to eat, good breakfast as well. Due to a special problem with our son havivg been diagnosed with cancer we left suddenly for home and left keys behind, they sent them back to us by mail, and were very good at giving us the best and quickest route home. Excellent room and treatment Ed and Betty McIntyre

Reviews.Title: “First class Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: coolrunning70
Reviews.Content: Called to confirm reservations and was told Jacuzzi Suite was free standing and that rates were 169.95. When we got there, rate was 199.95 due to " convention in town". Room was filthy, mold on carpet and tub. Jacuzzi was suppose to be two person, only if your 4 foot 9 or smaller. Checked into a King, room smelled, carpet molded so, we ate that rate and moved to another hotel. Seems no one else was full from convention goers and Pacific Inn was still booking people to rooms at astronomical rates. The nightly rate was three times what their normal rate was. This has got to be the worst place I have ever checked into. I found both rooms we were put in, dirty, moldy and far below livable standars.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but you've gotta love trains!”
Reviews.Author: JWwanderer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice budget motel located within walking distance of the San Diego waterfront with its attractions and restaurants. Also close to the airport, the Little Italy section with its good restaurants, and the train station. It's so close that the train whistle as it passes street crossings is loud, especially at night when all else is quiet. Rooms are clean, average size, and functional. Breakfast is OK, nothing special. Staff is competent.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: marcusfocus
Reviews.Content: This place was nice enough, limited parking though. It was expensive for what it was too. Very close to the railway so a lot of noise from the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place when Cruising”
Reviews.Author: JamersOmaha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Inn Hotel and Suites the night prior to going on cruise to the Mexican Riviera. It is not fancy. But it had everything we wanted. The $91 price (room and taxes) was a bargain. This included a continental breakfast. The room was neat. The bed was comfortable and it was quiet. There were several restaurants in the area that we could walk to. And we were quite close to the cruise dock. Shari, the front desk lady, was very pleasant and helpful. She told us about a tour of San Diego that we took that very day. We will definitely stay there the next time we are in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Seaport”
Reviews.Author: jessparadis
Reviews.Content: Overall it was not bad. The room was clean, however smelled bad. Good price for us, but was more expensive for the people behind us. Close to airport and walking distance from all the sites. Free breakfast, great hot waffles. Free wireless internet. Good place to stay for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Stay in San Diego near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Kajsalb
Reviews.Content: After a long day at work in D.C., then a long flight to San Diego that I almost didn't get on due to a weight restriction, I finally arrived @ 10 pm at the San Diego airport and no place to stay. My flight to SFO the next morning was @ 6:20am so I was desparate to find a room as soon as possible. We are required to use a particular hotel and rental car link on our intranet but using it I was unable to find a hotel anywhere in San Diego. Finally, after about an hour on the phone, I was able to book directly with this hotel, near the airport, for my less than 7 hour stay there! It was inexpensive and very close to the airport, less than 5 minutes by taxi. The room was a more typical of a motel than an "inn" to be truthful. The blanket was very dingy, thin, and old and pillows unimpressive. The room was clean enough but nothing to right home about. The street noise was also significant - my room, located on the ground floor, was not quiet. Having said this, it met my needs for this very, very short stay and for that I was grateful. It is close to resaurants in Little Italy just two blocks behind the hotel, away from the harbor, and across the railroad tracks. Given the quality of the room appointments I think it was very overpriced. Just a few days later, I stayed at an Chicago O'Hare Hyatt for only $55.00/night that was infinately more pleasant, well-appointed, and newer.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Inn was nice”
Reviews.Author: SueSueGeorge
Reviews.Content: A clean, affordable place with very nice personnel. Very helpful with giving directions and tips on getting around, etc. Parking was limited but that was expected due to it being downtown. The rooms were very clean, but the doors were a little drafty so it made it hard to keep the rooms comfortable. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Mrbill62
Reviews.Content: Great Service!! David and Meredith Rich, who work at the front desk were very helpful. Comming back from a cruise we found the battery was dead in our car. David was very helpful calling the tow company and allowing us to use the facilities. Great people and great service. Bill and Charlene Weinger Tracy, Ca.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Amtrak Station”
Reviews.Author: Loveintotravel
Reviews.Content: Wanted a hotel near amtrak station, this hotel is about 5 or 6 blocks, cab fare was $5. Convenient to San Diego Pier we sailed on cruise the following day. Staff is very pleasant and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “My Room Went To The Highest Bidder...”
Reviews.Author: TMcCrae
Reviews.Content: After I booked my stay with them they called a couple of days before my trip to tell me that my nightly rate had gone up because Barry Bonds was going to be in town. I agreed to the higher rate and told the woman I would be arriving late. I got to the hotel at 7pm and my room...the last room available had been given away. The hotel was small with limited parking, no elevator just a motel. Also the counter person lied to me said they found another hotel I got there and there had been no call and no rooms available. I spent 2 hours calling and driving around trying to find another hotel with no help from this hotel. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. I ended up at the Best Western on Harbor , it was great and the people were friendly...give them a try.

Reviews.Title: “A standard motel with a great location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Steve_and_Oonagh
Reviews.Content: I always worry about a place that has reviews with all "5's" or all "1's". I figure that the "5's" were given by people who own that hotel and the "1's" are given by the people who own the hotel down the street. Reading the reviews for the Pacific Inn, they were all "1's" or "5's", so I want to add my unbiased review. My daughters and I needed an overnight place to stay near the Star of India in San Diego Bay for an event and the Pacific Inn fit our needs just fine. It's an older "motel-style" property with only about 40 rooms, but the rooms were clean and adequately furnished. No bugs, no mold, no overly obnoxious smells, everything worked, etc. The window-model air conditioners were noisy, but if you've ever stayed in a motel, you know this is usually the case. The staff, both at check-in and check-out, were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was somewhat limited, but certainly adequate with waffles, cereal, fruit, coffee, rolls, and orange juice. The swimming pool is small, but clean and inviting on a hot day. Overall, if you need a good value place to stay near Harbor Drive, the cruise terminal, etc., this is a fine place.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Lucky in San Diego during a Convention or Two.”
Reviews.Author: traveler1950
Reviews.Content: My mom just moved into Senior housing and I didn't want her to feel as though it were the end of the world, so on a lark we drove to San Diego in the middle of the week. We didn't have a reservation anywhere and everywhere we tried to check in was booked due to the Comic Con International, the American Idol auditions, and the Rodeo being in town at the same time. My mother was starting to panic! We were heading down Pacific Hwy when we spotted the Pacific Inn and Suites. We checked it out and we liked what we saw. At the Reservation Desk we met Sherrie, who was very pleasant, helpful and understanding (her grandmother is about my mom's age, so she knows what it is to travel with an elderly parent). Sherrie got us checked in and even though our room was not ready yet, she allowed my mother to use the facilities in another room. Again, Sherrie was very accomodating to the elderly. After a great lunch at a restaurant nearby, we got settled in our suite, which was neat, clean and cool, as it was extremely hot that day. Sherrie gave us perfect directions to get to the San Diego Zoo, and directions on how to get back to the Hotel that night. Later, the evening staff gave us directions to Old Town so we could get a Mexican meal for dinner that night. The next morning we had a great hot breakfast there at the Hotel and again, Sherrie gave us directions to Sea World with directions on how to get back to the Hotel from the park. We truly enjoyed our stay at the Pacific Inn and Suites. The entire staff was very helpful and accomodating to our every need. And please give Sherrie a big raise. She deserves it and is a great asset to your organization. Leslie Getty Rifle, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Rates- Defininetly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: UtahTraveller
Reviews.Content: After arriving to San Diego on vacation with my family we were booked at Harborview inn and suites by naming our own price at priceline. As a result of that facility being not suitable for my family to stay inn we found Pacific Inn. When most other hotels/motes were in the $179 per night range the gave us a room with two beds for $79 per night after explaining what we had been through. They were very accomidating, the rooms were nice and clean. Their continental breakfast was terrific, with fresh fruits, cereals, and delicious waffels, and pastries. The Service was excellent they always held to there word. For example, Jim one of the desk clerks called and ordered pizza for us. I would highly recommend this facility: Good location next to the harbor, clean rooms, great breakfast, and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Totally ripped off at this hotel”
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this motel before and been pleased I stopped by again. When I checked in I asked for a senior rate and negotiated down from 120 to 100 plus tax (later to learn that it was 65 on the web). I was not told anything about a major change in carpets going on in the following two days. There were mattresses everywhere and you could not walk in the narrow passageways. The noise continued from early in the morning to late at night. A mattress was even placed in my window so that I could not see the pool or the partial view of the bay. When I complained I was offered a 10 dollars off on the last night and a room down the hall, or a room at a companion motel, the Marina Inn (going for about 30 dollars less than my nightly at the Pacific Inn) by the manager. Take it or leave it. I just wanted my money back!!! What a rip off. I highly recommend that anyone considering these motels to avoid them and the marginal business practises of the people that own them. Professor R. Wellings Vancouver, Canada

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: nothappy111
Reviews.Content: 1. They said they have wireless internet, but there is no signal at all. I can not even use my laptop on their front desk. 2. Dirty Room, dirty bed. 3. Bugs are found in the restroom. The toilet is leaking and flash every few minutes. 3. Some guests might stayed there with their pets before you move in..... So do you want to take some biting bugs home? 4. Their manager is so rude. When you complain, they do not refund you. They just try to push you to their sister hotels. 5. I will never stay there or any of their sister hotels again. 6. They do not keep your reservation at all. They will sell the room to any walk-in people with higher price and push you to their sister hotels. My coworker met that problem last year. He confirmed 3 times: half a year, a week, the day before. They do not have a room for him when he arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Like The Plague”
Reviews.Author: DesiertoPaloma
Reviews.Content: Refraining from stronger language is difficult . . . I reserved two rooms 10 months in advance of a July 2006 convention. Six months prior, I doublechecked on the reservation -- no problems. 48 hours prior, I called to find they had no idea who I was, and they were completely booked (as was every hotel in a 25 mile radius). They said their computer system had crashed a few weeks earlier, and they lost the data. What type of professional hotel neglects to back-up vital information? A years worth of planning was a near disaster. My documentation, my confirmation number, my assurance that my room was booked? Worthless.

Reviews.Title: “Far From Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After college graduation from UC SB, some friends and I headed down to San Diego. Without much money, we saw the rate of Pacific Inn as a nice deal. We weren't expecting anything special for such a low price, but we were definitely expecting better than a dumpster is a good location. The review titled 'Bad Hotel' on Tripadvisor summed the general hotel up best: stained sheet, pubic filled towels, bad smells, sticky floors, unsafe area, unsanitary bathroom. I slept on the floor a lot in college (it's college and booze is a given), and the floors of my frat house were more comfortable than the beds at this place. When we decided to leave early our rate was hiked by 75%! We decided to take the hit, and just book it. We booked the Wyndham for only $5 more a night, and stayed there the rest of the trip. Definitely not a proceleusmatic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation well in advance and even received a confirmation several days before our trip to San Diego. This place advertises itself as a two-star facility with a free breakfast, queen-size beds, and close proximity to the cruise ship dock. When we arrived, we were told at the Pacific Inn and Hotel Suites that they were overbooked and we would be taken to another place. After waiting 30 minutes for a ride, we were taken to a run-down, shabby, creepy motel that was nothing like a two-star place, and, of course, there was no free breakfast or queen-size bed. The distance was much further from the dock. It was almost midnight and too late to search for better accomodations. I emailed Pacific Inn and asked for some compensation, but they did not reply.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away, dirty place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wanted a nice place for a night with my wife after I picked her up from the airport. The minute I walked into the room I knew I could not bring her to a dirty place like this. The carpets were in terrible stained condition, the walls were dirty, it had a musty smell, and it had some little 19" TV that did not get all the channels, esp. Fox so we could watch 24. When I asked for a room change she just told me that all the rooms were like that and there would be no difference. She did give me another room and it smelled like and ash try. I was there for a total of 20 minutes and it was 20 minutes too long. Probably the worst hotel I've ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “This Roach Motel was unbearable...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had just got back from staying at this establishment this last weekend. Being picky about where you rest your head is a different story, we just wanted a place that was fairly clean for our return from the convention. A recap: Night 1: [----------------------------] size of roach inside the shower, largest I’ve ever seen in Northern America. Night 2: Room heater had broken down and the hot water was not working… cold night in San Diego… Night 3: The Maid had left the room window open after cleaning, which left easy access for anyone who walked by to pop off the screen and have their way with our valuables When I approached the faculty – they said that it was procedure, and guaranteed that no one could have gotten into the room. From the looks of the room screens, it looks like it was very possible. I would recommend not staying in this facility for all the reasons above and for the fact that it was very expensive even for the area. A big mistake I will never make again.

Reviews.Title: “I've never been treated so rudely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights at the Pacific Inn and Suites in San Diego and would not recommend it to anyone... ever. We were visiting San Diego to attend the Holiday Bowl and had driven 13 hours from Northern California to San Diego. The day of check-in I called the hotel at noon to let them know that we would be arriving at approximately midnight. I wanted to be sure that they did not give away our reservation. At 1:15am I received a phone call from the front desk manager asking where I was and why I had not called him to tell him I was going to be late. When we arrived at the hotel about ten minutes later this man was so rude to me. He told me I was inconsiderate and had no concerns for him, making him stay up all night until I arrived. I have never been treated so rudely by a member of a hotel staff. I reminded him that I was the customer... this didn't seem to matter to him. I got the feeling that he spoke to me this way because I was a woman... he did not speak to my husband rudely when my husband came to the lobby to find out what was going on. The reason we chose this hotel was because we were traveling with our two (elderly & well behaved) dogs. What a mistake. The room was filthy. I spent both nights sleeping with a hooded sweatshirt, sweatpants, gloves and socks so I wouldn't have to touch the sheets. The bathroom was a disgrace with old, stained towels. I would highly recommend that you do more investigating than I did when trying to find a pet-friendly hotel in San Diego, CA.

Reviews.Title: “worst jacuzzi suite ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is not worth your money....i specifically asked for a non smoking room and i got a room that smelled like an ash tray. they only show you pictures of the jacuzzi because the room looks like trash. If you want to get away make sure you don't end up here. Didn't even get the internet price they advertise!! horrbile service

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a mistake staying at this motel! We stayed here on August 20th and were highly disapointed. I had reserved the room by calling the motel directly, and was assured a rate of $129.00. When we arrived and checked in, the price had gone up to $139.00. I told them what I was quoted and they insisted that they would never have quoted that. A complete lie! After leaving the office, another person who had checked in asked me what I had paid, because they felt they had been ripped off. They paid $269.00 for the same room! The motel was old and run down. The walls actually were smeared with dirt on the inside. The bathroom had tons of mold and the towels were old and dingy. The soap provided was the cheapest quality you could offer. They did not offer shampoo in a little bottle, but a TACO BELL type packet. All staff that worked there were completely rude and did not even care if you were unhappy. The soda and snack machine on the premises were completely empty. The only good thing I could say about this motel was the location. Would never recommend this motel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked way in advance for a 10 day stay and got the rate specified on the website. I got there and the floor was sticky, pubic hairs were in the towels, they had a horrible breakfast selection, stains in the sheets, very uncomfortable beds, no internet unless you dial up for a price, there was mold and spiderwebs in the bathroom, no elevators, and this really creepy guy knocked on the door at 3am. After one day we realized 10 days here will really ruin our vacation. I gave them 48 hours advance notice I'll be checking out early and so they doubled the price of the room. We were so ready to leave we paid the extra money and booked the Holiday Inn on the Bay. That stay was cheaper and better. And the Holiday Inn is a better location. The only good thing was the very friendly guy at the front desk. If I was just staying one night I would stay there. But if I'm going there for fun I'm staying as far away as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Gangsters, do not go there during a meeting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: These guys rip you off!! We have made reservations 4 months before we got there during a meeting for a reasonable price. However, when we got there the reservations were gone, they were lying something about a water problem. I guess they sold the room to other people for a higher price. Although they found another hotel for us, it was a nightmare: Way of in hotel circle (about 5 miles), the manager did not care about who had to pay the cab and bring us there, this other hotel was a dump. These guys do not hold reservations, if they can, they just sell the rooms for higher prices. I cannot believe this happens. SO DO NOT RELY ON THEM!! DO NOT GO THERE!!

HotelInfo.Name: Pacific Inn Hotel & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 1655 Pacific Highway, San Diego, CA 92101
